title: Macbook 820-00239 SSD
message:
Display Flex is ripped off. ( FlexGate )
Question Mark Folder Flashing.

Just connected the board on table to a external monitor to rule keypad and any other flex shorting.

R9350 PICCOLO_IUVD is 1.8V

title: Macbook 820-00239 SSD
message:
If try going into recovery (CMD + R) it shows an error -2100F.

If i use an external drive to Flash the OS (Using the Option Button) it shows computer restarted because of an error and then just the Apple Logo and the loading bar and it gets stuck there.

title: Macbook 820-00239 SSD
message:
Does it enter target disk mode?

Check J9600's signals and voltages.
Be sure to have good contacts left/right.

title: Macbook 820-00239 SSD
message:
PPVIN_2V7NAND_LB IS 0V
PP3V3_S5_SSD_LB IS 0.7V
PP3V3_S5 IS 3.3V
PP5V_S4 IS 5V
PPBUS-G3H IS 13V

title: Macbook 820-00239 SSD
message:
Did you check on both sides of J9600?
Be sure to have good contacts in connector.

title: Macbook 820-00239 SSD
message: by both sides you mean back side of the motherboard?

title: Macbook 820-00239 SSD
message:
No, I mean both sides of J9600.
I hope the connector isn't empty...

title: Macbook 820-00239 SSD
message: No its not empty. You want me to re-solder the connector just in case.

title: Macbook 820-00239 SSD
message:
No!
Just confirm to have good continuity left/right; referring to schematic.

title: Macbook 820-00239 SSD
message: Continuity between Points 68 and 67 of J9600

title: Macbook 820-00239 SSD
message:
Something like that, but for all pins pair.
I doubt to have problems on the ground lines.

title: Macbook 820-00239 SSD
message:
By Pairs you mean 45/46 and 41/42 and so on.

Getting 
5.5 MOhms 45/46

title: Macbook 820-00239 SSD
message:
Yes, that is.
When J9600 metal plate is inserted, you MUST get 0 ohm between each pins pair.

title: Macbook 820-00239 SSD
message: This connector is difficult to check with the metal plate installed. How do i check it ?

title: Macbook 820-00239 SSD
message:
Use boardview and find proper test points.
Work with the board alone on the desk.

title: Macbook 820-00239 SSD
message:
37-45 / 38-46 is 0.4Ohms
35/36 is 1.8 Ohms
31/32 , 29/30 , 25/26 , 23/24 , 19/20 , 17/18 Couldn't find test points.
13/14 is 3.4 Ohms
11/12 is 3.2 Ohms
7/8 is 1.5Ohms
5/6 is 1.3 Ohms
3/4 is 1.8 Ohms
1/2is 0.8 Ohms
43/44 os 0.5 Ohms

title: Macbook 820-00239 SSD
message:
"PP3V3_S5_SSD_LB IS 0.7V
PP3V3_S5 IS 3.3V
------------------
37-45 / 38-46 is 0.4Ohms"
All these readings can't be true at same time...

title: Macbook 820-00239 SSD
message:
If i Disconnect the J9600 connector and measure 
37-45/38-46 is 2.8 M Ohms and reducing
PP3V3_S5 is 3.3V
PP3V3_S5_SSD_LB is 0.7V

If the connector is connected
37-45/38-46 is 1.2 Ohms
PP3V3_S5 is 3.3V
PP3V3_S5_SSD_LB is 3.3V

title: Macbook 820-00239 SSD
message:
You don't need to make any test with J9600 disconnected.

Post voltage for pins 2, 4, 6, 8, 12, 36, 44.
As always, find proper test points; look near U9013 area.

title: Macbook 820-00239 SSD
message:
Ya that is where i checking 

Pin 2 =  5v
Pin 4 = 1.78v
Pin 6 = 0v
Pin 8 = 3.3v
Pin 12 = 3.3V
Pin 36 = 3.3V
Pin 44 = 13V

title: Macbook 820-00239 SSD
message: Boot USB macOS and check if internal SSD is recognized in Disk Utility.

title: Macbook 820-00239 SSD
message:
When i boot usb macos and connect it to a external screen (the screen flex is torn).
It gets stuck in the apple logo with loading bar - after selecting the macos and booting option

title: Macbook 820-00239 SSD
message: Does it load macOS from USB with J9600 disconnected?

title: Macbook 820-00239 SSD
message:
Its the same. I press the option button. Select Macos from bootable disk.
Apple Logo comes. 
The the loading bar appears and then it stops there.

Nothing beyond that.

title: Macbook 820-00239 SSD
message: Try known good BIOS, clean ME...
